title: What’s Happening in Space Policy December 8-14, 2024
summary: Here is SpacePolicyOnline.com’s list of space policy events for the week of December 8-14, 2024 and any insight we can offer about them. The House and Senate are in session […]

title: Nelson “basically optimistic” about NASA’s future in the next administration
summary:
The outgoing administrator of NASA says he is “basically optimistic” about the future of the agency under the person proposed by President-elect Donald Trump to be his successor despite the strong possibility of significant changes to Artemis.
The post Nelson “basically optimistic” about NASA’s future in the next administration appeared first on SpaceNews.

title: NDAA extends commercial spaceflight learning period and launch indemnification
summary:
A defense authorization bill includes language to extend a “learning period” limiting commercial human spaceflight regulations as well as indemnification for commercial launches.
The post NDAA extends commercial spaceflight learning period and launch indemnification appeared first on SpaceNews.

title: Globalstar and Parsons unveil satellite service for defense market
summary:
The collaboration leverages Globalstar's low-Earth orbit satellite infrastructure and Parsons' signal processing technology
The post Globalstar and Parsons unveil satellite service for defense market appeared first on SpaceNews.

title: Heliophysics decadal survey recommends two flagship missions for NASA
summary:
A new decadal survey for solar and space physics recommends that NASA’s heliophysics program pursue two billion-dollar missions even as the agency proposes to cancel a recommendation from the previous decadal.
The post Heliophysics decadal survey recommends two flagship missions for NASA appeared first on SpaceNews.

title: Italy Begins Development of Nuclear Reactor for Lunar Settlements
summary:
Italy’s national space agency, ASI, has kicked off its Selene project, which aims to develop small nuclear fission reactors to power settlements on the Moon. In 2023, the Selene (Sistema Energetico Lunare con l’Energia Nucleare) project was among the winners of an ASI funding call aimed at developing alternative energy solutions for the Moon that […]
The post Italy Begins Development of Nuclear Reactor for Lunar Settlements appeared first on European Spaceflight.

title: Students Aim High at NASA JPL ‘Candy Toss’ Competition
summary: Treats went flying through the air by the dozens at the annual Invention Challenge at NASA’s Jet Propulsion Laboratory. title: Neuraspace installs second telescope to enhance space traffic monitoring
summary:
Portuguese space traffic management startup Neuraspace has installed a second optical telescope to help track low Earth orbit objects across both hemispheres.
The post Neuraspace installs second telescope to enhance space traffic monitoring appeared first on SpaceNews.
